meanings.sent1: After summer break, I will reschool myself to prepare for the new school year.
meanings.sent2: Parents may choose to reschool their children at home instead of sending them to a traditional school.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to reschool the students on the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent4: She needed to reschool her mind to think more positively.
meanings.sent5: The online course aims to reschool adults who want to learn new skills.

meanings.sent1: The organization's mission is to reschool underprivileged children in rural areas.
meanings.sent2: The government plans to reschool adults who did not have access to education in their youth.
meanings.sent3: The parents decided to reschool their children after realizing the importance of education.
meanings.sent4: The mentor took it upon himself to reschool the young students in the community.
meanings.sent5: The program aims to reschool individuals who want to further their knowledge.

meanings.sent1: The reschool of the students after winter break was smooth and successful.
meanings.sent2: The reschool of the teachers on new teaching methods was beneficial for the entire school.
meanings.sent3: Attending the reschool helped the students review and reinforce their learning.
meanings.sent4: The reschool of the community members on disaster preparedness was informative and engaging.
meanings.sent5: The reschool of the employees on safety procedures was necessary for a secure work environment.
